Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.board

Class Warehouse

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.board.Warehouse
public class Warehouse extends Object
Class Warehouse describes the container where a player can store his resources. It is composed by three shelves where the first one can store only one resource while the second shelf has to have two resources of the same type and the third one contains three resources of the same type.
Author:
Alessio Piovesan, Pier Giorgio Prosperi, Matteo Salamone

    • moveResources

      protected void moveResources​(int lvl, Pick add)
      Method moveResources is used to place a resource in a desired shelf
      Parameters:
      lvl - of type int - indicates the shelf where the resource is going to be stored
      add - of type Pick - the resource being added

    • checkIfEmptied

      private void checkIfEmptied()
      Method checkIfEmptied is used to check if the shelf is empty. If it is empty our default "empty" value is colour: WHITE and quantity: 0

    • isThereThatRes

      protected int isThereThatRes​(Colours color)
      Method isThereThatRes checks if a resource is in the warehouse, and if there is one, it can tell on which shelf is stored
      Parameters:
      color - of type Colours
      Returns:
      i of type int - shelf or "-1" if the resource is not in the warehouse

      of type Pick - resources on the shelf

    • checkAdd

      protected boolean checkAdd​(int lvl, Pick add)
      Method checkAdd checks if a resource can be stored in a specified shelf
      Parameters:
      lvl - of type int - number of shelf where you want to store the resource
      add - of type Pick - colour and quantity

      boolean
